title: "Games Change... Adapt or Leave."
body:
Is the most idiotic response to a gameplay complaint that anyone ever started. It's a shame it has become such a trendy piece of garbage to spout, as if it somehow proves someone's point.

"I won't tell you why you are wrong, because I have no actual counter point, and therefore your statement is stupid."

Exactly how it reads. 

A lot of us here, especially on these boards, have played this game 8-9+ years. We've adapted, changed, and manipulated play styles countless times over this decade. For some player who popped their head on seven and a half years after this game started to respond to, often admittedly invalid, complaints by telling them "well, adapt. The game changes." Is a lot like me telling you "Welp, people die. Move on" when a loved one passes away.

It's a useless statement that contributes nothing to the player's knowledge, does nothing to change their outlook, and simply makes you to be an ass. When a player is wrong, which we **all** are occasionally... point out WHY you feel they are wrong. Actually contribute.

------------

Edit: Meant to hit General Chat
Edit 2: **No where in this post do I say anything, anything, anything... ANYTHING... about RIOT, the state of the game, any champions etc.  This post has nothing to do with anything other than how players treat other players.**
Edit 3: Wtf happened here? I never intended this post to explode into insanity.

"Give me a reason to believe all the hate Riot receives, why it is justified, and why the millions should give a shit. (With the exception of the farting in employers faces and doing sexual harassment to both men and women story. That is completely understandable hate.)"

They're changing the game to better benefit their Asian audience (mainly China) as opposed to appealing to the west where the game was initially nurtured and loved. 

Another reason? They hardly ever listen to the community, and if they do it's half-arsed.

They never do live Q&As or actively respond to their playerbase because they're too scared of the backlash and they know they'll get decimated, so they choose to hide behind their identities and slink back into the shadows of /r/LeagueOfLegends and Boards where they have the power to silence those who tell the truth; or let their hoard of fanboys defend them (most of which are new players and/or metaslaves who jerk off the Asian competitive scene, dawning it "the best thing" they've ever watched).

They ruin champions through reworks for the most part and then it takes them almost 2 years to respond to a champion they've left in the dust. 

They directly copy other successful features from successful companies/corporations. E.g. A direct ripoff of Facebook's UI layout for the main client menu, loot boxes linked to progression, faster games to optimise experience for internet/LAN cafe users.

Except they don't have any of the features we've actually been asking for such as:
A 3d model viewer for ALL skins, a proper optimised practice/sandbox tool, more than 1 permanent gamemode (ARAM and standard 5v5 may as well be the same thing) and user option editing for custom games (e.g. removing cooldowns, buffing/nerfing damage, buffing/nerfing champs, ability draft in that custom game). Oh, and a tool for users to create their own maps and champs and such specifically for custom games. 

Honestly that last point alone is enough reason to hate Riot. The only reason DOTA 2 isn't taking over by storm is because of its generally frustrating mechanics and somewhat slow gameplay. Other than that DOTA 2 is just better than League in every single way (outside of its recent balance history, which was taken from LoL's influence). Seriously, why does LoL still not have options for users to change to create their own custom gamemodes? Why is there only one mode?????

Oh yeah also, that woman in that article was found to be openly lying, so just this one time I can say that Riot Games definitely did not promote sexism in its general workplace stations. Just thought I'd comment on that.

Most of the things that I read here are "nerf this, because this and this" they add some reasoning behind their thoughts. Feelings about something don't come from thin air. For example, when I say that Neeko has too much dmg, which is true, and you say that she has low win rate, I don't give a shit. She is unbalanced and has too much damage, because her design is based on "she is only useful if she has dmg" logic. Think about her kit. She cannot be nerfed so that she is balanced, if she gets nerfed she will be useless, if she gets buffed she will be broken. There is no middle ground for this champion. That is how bad design looks like and I will abuse her, until they rework her again. 

Also none of her abilities are polished. Her ult doesn't even fit in her kit. Her w cannot change directions. Her q isn't even connected to her lore. Her e is ... lux q. Also not connected with her lore. She is a fucking cameleon, they could add some tongue attack or something. 

There is no argument that is more meaningful that the other. There is good argument, the valid one and the bad argument, based on bad understanding of the topic. Before you look at something in a way "Riot is, nerf, delete, nerf, delete, or champion is broken" first read the reasoning behind that statement, because it might be valid. Even if there is some bullshit in there, if you counter his point and he seems to understand your thought, he might change his mind in a way.

Each new season more people turn up and the game is getting bigger and bigger with each free expansion. Playerbase knows that GGG care about them and they appreciate it.

The game should be created for players, but at this moment the playerbase is divided and cannot be united anymore. In gaming industry a company has only one chance. They can never make a mistake. They need to be connected with playerbase.

We deeply despise this new direction and "adapting" this time is something we're unwilling to do. I'd rather leave than adapt in order to perform competitively  at something that I consider exremely unfun.

I got to diamond playing the champions I liked and it was FUN (atleast for me).
I still do trolls with my friends in flex like voli and ornn bot and we are doing FUN.
What I want to say is you can play every champ you want and if you are good with him, you can hit masters easily.

I got to d2 this season playing udyr top, planning to hit masters this season. I don't know if you see a lot of udyr top in your elo (whatever it is) but I don't see anyone who plays it.

It does hurt tho when your champion is getting nerfed so hard that you can't play it anymore the way you did before.

But if it does happen to you, it means you play a meta champion that literly everyone abuses. That's why udyr didn't get a buff/nerf for almost 2 years I think.

I do think that the game was a lot funnier back in the days, where you could go 2 v 2 in top, getting the first blood in 0:40 of the game.

Meta changes, its true, but you don't have to move on with the meta like a lot of players does.

It's not a meta problem. The meta has remained relatively untouched throughout the endish of the season to now. It's just that damage is going higher and higher and as we've seen they have no intention of slowing down.

The champions I play are typically not meta or unpopular but I play them simply cuz I like their theme or kit and do just fine (D3 last season... was D1 a week before it ended rip end of season games).

So yeah, I'm adapting to meta shifts just fine but SR's "burst or be bursted" meta just feels so hollow compared to previous seasons. NB on the other hand is always a blast and is really the main reason I'm still here right now.

Maybe it's my personal experience, but I used to play whatever the fuck I wanted. I still do it, to an extent. Now, I feel like I can't anymore.

Years ago, I used to love Nautilus jungle. Me and maybe 3 other people worldwide played Nautilus  jungle. I got flamed pretty often for "troll picking" in champ  select. I played him a lot, and was incredibly successful with him in my elo. I was the first to say: "play what you want and you will win regardless". But then 2 years ago I started picking him again, and oh boi was I struggling... in gold elo. Mind you, I started one tricking WW as he was released and got to D5 (solo) and D1 (flex) steadily fast (65% wr). I found more success with playing a brand new champ I knew nothing about, than with my beloved main I have had experience for years. This is when I realized that league balance wasn't what it used to be, and you were allowed to play only a (maybe wide) selection of meta champions.

I was literally dying in the jungle with him, and all the champions I used to be deceptively able to duel now were oneshotting me. I was coming from a 2-year break from lol, so I felt the hit like a truck.
Tbh I can't stand people that genuinely think Riot cannot do any wrong.

It's only an idiotic response when used in the wrong context. 

Responding "games change, adapt or leave" to someone saying "I no longer enjoy the current meta" is idiotic because enjoyment is subjective and its difficult to adapt how you have fun. 

Responding "games change, adapt or leave" to someone saying "I can't win on (insert champion) anymore because riot nerfed them from being freelo", "I can no longer win by treating top lane as an island and ignoring everything else until 20 min", "why can't I win games when I play jungle?", etc..  isn't idiotic. It's not particularly constructive, it's not that helpful, and it's not nice,

but it's not wrong either. It's just crude and basic. The specifics of "the game has changed" and "adapt" depend heavily on what strategies you're talking about. It can be as obvious as "you can't win on poppy anymore by building {{item:3078}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} because the game has changed" to as complicated and in depth as "as the meta has shifted over the years, you're going to need to shift your playstyle in the jungle to be more gank focused because, with the removal of feral flare and later devourer, farm heavy junglers are far less effective than they once were. Here is how you need to change up your playstyle in order to be more effective, starting with..."

Context is everything and I'm not sure I even addressed the point you were making in this post because it's so open ended and basic, but I tried.

"Adapt or leave" is a rephrasing of "love it or leave it," more formally known as the false dichotomy fallacy. When applied to a business's products and services, it ends up harming the business, as customers leave the business relationship rather than trying to maintain it.
